intro: Phyllospadix torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, where it thrives in saline and well-drained conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Phyllospadix torreyi plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
